title: Iran Terrorist IRGC Vows Violence Against  Child - Killing Zionist Criminals
message:
The head of Iran’s terrorist Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC), Maj. Gen. Hossein Salami, declared in remarks on Wednesday that Iran would take vengeance on Israel for an airstrike against an IRGC terrorist attributed to Jerusalem.
Salami’s threats on Wednesday were in response to an airstrike in Syria targeting the IRGC, a U.S.-designated terrorist organization.
The airstrike eliminated 17 people, according to PressTV, including IRGC “military adviser” Saeed Abyar, reportedly a member of the IRGC Quds Force, its foreign terrorist operations outfit.
Despite this, Salami blamed the strike on Israel and said Iran expects to attack Israel in response in the near future.
Iranian regime officials similarly threatened to attack Israel following the strike, claiming no Israeli embassy in the world was safe from Iranian retribution.
event_breakdown: Top Iranian officials threatened to attack Israel in response to an airstrike in Syria on Saturday that the Revolutionary Guards have blamed on Israel.

message:

The Israeli military said its fighter jets struck the school run by the United Nations agency providing aid to the Palestinians, known by the acronym UNRWA.
The Israeli military claimed, without immediately offering evidence, that Hamas and the Islamic Jihad used the school as cover for their operations.
It is a built-up Palestinian refugee camp in central Gaza dating back to the 1948 Arab-Israeli war.

title: 30 killed in Israeli bombing on Gaza school ( Ld )
message:
Gaza, June 6 : Thirty Palestinians were killed, most of them children and women, and dozens injured in an Israeli airstrike targeting a school housing displaced people in the Nuseirat camp in the central Gaza Strip, medical sources told the media on Thursday morning.
According to the sources, an Israeli fighter jet bombed at least three classrooms with several missiles, Xinhua news agency reported.
In a statement, Hamas-run Gaza government media office condemned Israel's attack on the school as a "terrible massacre," saying that the continued implementation of these attacks by the Israeli army "is clear evidence of the crime of genocide committed against civilians".
The office said that Israel and the US "should bear full responsibility for these crimes that endanger humanity and violate international law".
The Israeli side has yet to respond to the incident.
event_breakdown: Gaza, 9 killed

title: MACAU DAILY TIMES 澳門每日時報US flies B - 1B bomber for first precision bomb drill in seven years
message:
The United States flew a long-range B-1B bomber over the Korean Peninsula yesterday [Macau time] for its first precision-guided bombing drill with South Korea in seven years, the South’s military said.
The exercise was meant to demonstrate the U.S. security commitment to South Korea and strengthen the allies’ joint defense posture, according to the South Korean Defense Ministry.
During the training, the B-1B dropped Joint Direct Attack Munitions while being escorted by South Korean jets, the first such bombing drill for a U.S. bomber since 2017, a ministry statement said.
North Korea has responded to past flights of B-1Bs and other powerful U.S. aircraft in South Korea with its own missile tests.
It also test-fired nuclear-capable weapons for a drill simulating a pre-emptive strike on South Korea, and allegedly jammed GPS navigation signals in South Korea.
event_breakdown: The United States flew a long-range B-1B bomber over the Korean Peninsula for its first precision-guided bombing drill with South Korea in seven years. The exercise was meant to demonstrate the US security commitment to South Korea and strengthen the allies’ joint defense posture, according to the South Korean Defense Ministry.

During the first phase, Israel and Hamas would continue to negotiate to reach the second phase: a permanent cease-fire, the withdrawal of all Israeli troops from Gaza and the freeing of all remaining living hostages.

title: Commemorating the 80th anniversary of the D - Day invasion
message:
The 80th anniversary of the Normandy invasion is Thursday, and with it comes commemorations on the beaches of France where allied troops landed.
Ninety-nine-year-old Richard “Dick” Rung of Carol Stream recalled the Germans waited from atop the cliffs that encased the fiercely protected crescent-shaped Omaha Beach, one of five landing sites of the Normandy Invasion.
In a nursing home in Durand about three hours northwest of Chicago, on the edge of a small town nicknamed the “Village of Volunteers,” three World War II veterans are talking about the upcoming 80th anniversary of D-Day.
We recognize and honor the 80th anniversary of the greatest such operation, the Allies’ invasion of France in World War II on June 6, 1944 – D-Day.
The Normandy invasion combined thorough planning, mobilizing vast materiel and great imagination.
event_breakdown: 80th anniversary of the Normandy invasion

title: See powerful images of D - Day , 80 years later
message:
The greatest sacrificeThe bodies of Americans killed fighting for the liberation of France lie in a makeshift graveyard in Normandy.
After the war, the bodies were recovered and transported back to the United States or to cemeteries in Europe.
On D-Day alone—June 6, 1944—2,501 Americans were killed, making up more than half of the total Allied deaths that day.
Album/Granger, NYCGuiding in the glidersGliders of the U.S. Ninth Air Force land in Normandy on the first day of the invasion.

title: Day 244 : 32 Killed in Another School Massacre by Israeli Forces
message:
At least 32 civilians were killed and dozens more were seriously injured when an Israeli missile targeted the Nuseirat Preparatory Boys School, which is one of the schools being used as a makeshift shelter for Palestinians in Nuseirat camp, in central Gaza.
An Israeli warplane targeted the upper floors of the school around 2:15 a.m. while the people there were sleeping.
Also in Nuseirat camp, 6 civilians were killed and others were injured as a result of the Israeli occupation warplanes bombing a house belonging to the Al-Madani family in the camp.
The Israeli occupation artillery launched a violent bombardment on the eastern area of ​​the Bureij camp in the middle of the Gaza Strip, and the Israeli Quadcopter warplane also opened fire in the vicinity of the Nakheel Hall in the camp.
The occupation artillery fired shells at citizens’ homes east of the town of Al-Qarara, northeast of the city of Khan Yunis, south of the Gaza Strip.

title: IDF strikes Hamas terrorists operating inside UNRWA school in Gaza
message:
Israeli Air Force fighter jets conducted a precise strike on a Hamas compound embedded inside a UNRWA school in the area of Nuseirat in the central Gaza Strip overnight between Wednesday and Thursday, the IDF confirmed on Thursday morning.
The airstrike was directed by IDF intelligence and the Israel Security Agency, according to the IDF, and eliminated terrorists who participated in the October 7 massacre.
1 View gallery Infographic of the school complex where the terrorists were operating: ( Photo: IDF Spokesperson's Unit )The terrorists directed terror from the area of the school while exploiting it and using it as a shelter.
Several terrorists who planned to carry out terror attacks and promote terrorist activities against IDF troops in the immediate time frame were eliminated in the strike, the IDF said.
On Wednesday, the IDF announced the launch of a divisional operation in the central Gaza Strip in the al-Bureij refugee camp and in Deir al-Balah.
event_breakdown: IDF fighter jets conduct precise strike on Gaza terror compound embedded in UNRWA school.

title: Israel military says it targeted  Hamas compound  in a school
message:
The Israeli military said its fighter jets struck the school run by the United Nations agency providing aid to the Palestinians.
Israel’s military said on Thursday that it targeted what it called a “Hamas compound” inside of a school in the Gaza Strip, an attack that Hamas-affiliated media said killed at least 39 people.
The Israeli military said its fighter jets struck the school run by the United Nations agency providing aid to the Palestinians, known by the acronym UNRWA.
The Israeli military claimed, without immediately offering evidence, that Hamas and the Islamic Jihad used the school as cover for their operations.
The Israeli military published a graphic of the school, which clearly had “UN” on its roof.
event_breakdown: The Israeli attack took place late on Wednesday night in Gaza.

title: Yemen Houthi rebels unveil solid - fuel  Palestine  missile that resembles Iranian hypersonic
message:
This frame grab from video released by the Ansar Allah Media Office of Yemen's Houthi rebels on Wednesday, June 5, 2024, shows the launch of a Palestine missile from a rebel-controlled area of Yemen.
Yemen's Houthi rebels have unveiled a new, solid-fuel missile in their arsenal that resembles aspects of one earlier displayed by Iran that Tehran described as flying at hypersonic speeds.
The rebels fired its new “Palestine” missile, complete with a warhead painted like a Palestinian keffiyeh checkered scarf, at the southern Gulf of Aqaba port of Eilat in Israel on Monday.
For their part, the Houthis described the Palestine as a “locally made” missile.
Iranian media reported the launch of the Palestine and described it as locally manufactured, citing the Houthis.

title: Houthi rebels unveil solid - fuel missile that resembles Iranian hypersonic weapon
message:
The rebels fired the new Palestine missile, complete with a warhead painted like a Palestinian checkered scarf, at the southern Gulf of Aqaba port of Eilat in Israel on Monday.
Iranian media reported the launch of the Palestine and described it as locally manufactured, citing the Houthis.
Iran unveiled the missile last year and claimed it could reach Mach 15 — 15 times the speed of sound.
It described the missile’s range as up to 870 miles, which is a little short of Eilat from Houthi-controlled areas of Yemen, but the missile can be reconfigured to boost its range.
Hypersonic weapons, which fly at speeds higher than Mach 5, could pose crucial challenges to missile defence systems because of their speed and manoeuvrability.

title: Israel military says it targeted  Hamas compound  in a school | Bradford Telegraph and Argus
message:
The Israeli military said its fighter jets struck the school run by the United Nations agency providing aid to the Palestinians, known by the acronym UNRWA.
The Israeli military claimed, without immediately offering evidence, that Hamas and the Islamic Jihad used the school as cover for their operations.
It is a built-up Palestinian refugee camp in central Gaza dating back to the 1948 Arab-Israeli war.
The Israeli military published a graphic of the school, which clearly had “UN” on its roof.
More than 1 million people have fled Rafah since the start of the operation, with many heading towards central Gaza.
event_breakdown:
In response to the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas, the Israeli military said it struck UNRWA school on Thursday. The army alleged that Hamas and the Islamic Jihad had used the school building as cover for their operations.

UNRWA's statement on the attack: "Most of the approximately 81,000 people it shelters in Gaza - 69,000 of them in Gaza's 10 camps - have been displaced by fighting or live in homes damaged by it." The school served as a refuge for those who were displaced.

The Israeli army's graphic clearly indicated "UN" on top of the school building, which is located in the built-up Palestinian refugee camp in central Gaza state.

More than 1 million people have left Rafah since the start of the operation and headed towards central Gaza.

The UN condemned the attack, but it is not clear if there were casualties .

title: Ukraine Drone Strike Halts Operations At Russian Refinery
message:
Moscow, (APP - UrduPoint / Pakistan Point News - 6th Jun, 2024) A Ukrainian drone attack ignited a fire at an oil refinery in southern Russia, forcing it to halt operations, the regional governor said early Thursday, adding that there were no casualties.
In Rostov-on-Don city, dozens of emergency personnel rushed to put out the flames at the Novoshakhtinsk refinery, according to Governor Vasily Golubev.
"Following a drone strike, a fire broke out at the Novoshakhtinsk refinery," Golubev wrote on Telegram.
Another drone strike overnight destroyed an oil tank at a depot in Stary Oskol, north of the Ukrainian border, said Belgorod Region Governor Vyacheslav Gladkov.
Ukraine, which has been facing a Russian offensive since February 2022, has upped its attacks on Russian territory in recent months.

title: Israeli airstrike hits UN school in central Gaza
message:
Israel’s military carried out an airstrike Thursday on a U.N. school in central Gaza where Palestinian health officials said at least 27 people were killed.
The Hamas media office rejected Israel’s statement and said Israeli forces had carried out a "brutal crime" against displaced people.
The Israeli military Wednesday announced the start of "targeted operational activity" near the same area, in parts of Deir al-Balah and the Bureij refugee camp.
At least 70 people died and 300 were wounded since Tuesday, following "heavy Israeli strikes" in central Gaza, according to Doctors Without Borders.
About 120 of the hostages remain in Gaza, although the Israeli military says 37 of them are dead.

The UN said preliminary reports showed at least 52 civilians were killed in the school.
Israel says it was targeting three Islamic Jihad commanders about to fire rockets at the Jewish state.
The UN said the attack on the school was likely a "disgraceful breach of international law".

title: Ukraine Drone Strike Halts Operations at Russian Oil Refinery
message:
A Ukrainian drone attack started a fire at an oil refinery in southern Russia, forcing it to halt operations, regional authorities said early Thursday, adding that there were no casualties.
Russia's Defense Ministry said 13 drones were destroyed overnight in annexed Crimea, six in the southwestern Belgorod region and an anti-ship missile was shot down in the southern Rostov region.
In the city of Rostov-on-Don, dozens of emergency personnel rushed to put out the flames at the Novoshakhtinsk refinery, according to Rostov region Governor Vasily Golubev.
"Following a drone strike, a fire broke out at the Novoshakhtinsk refinery," he wrote on Telegram.
"Work was suspended due to a repeated attack, and personnel were withdrawn to a safe distance."

title: At least 30 killed in Israeli bombing on Gaza school
message:
Gaza: Thirty Palestinians were killed, most of them children and women, and dozens injured in an Israeli airstrike targeting a school housing displaced people in the Nuseirat camp in the central Gaza Strip, medical sources told the media on Thursday morning.
According to the sources, an Israeli fighter jet bombed at least three classrooms with several missiles, Xinhua news agency reported.
Also Read Slovenia officially recognises Palestine as a stateIn a statement, Hamas-run Gaza government media office condemned Israel’s attack on the school as a “terrible massacre,” saying that the continued implementation of these attacks by the Israeli army “is clear evidence of the crime of genocide committed against civilians”.
The office said that Israel and the US “should bear full responsibility for these crimes that endanger humanity and violate international law”.
The Israeli side has yet to respond to the incident.

title: Israel kills 39 Palestinians with airstrike targeting UNRWA school in central Gaza
message:
At least 39 displaced Palestinians were killed on Thursday in an Israeli airstrike on a school sheltering thousands of displaced people in Gaza city's Nuseirat refugee camp, according to local authorities.
In a statement, the Gaza-based Government Media Office said the Israeli army struck a UN agency for Palestinian refugees-run school in the Nuseirat refugee camp also leaving dozens of people injured.
It added that the Israeli army's relentless “massacres” in Gaza is proof that it continues the “genocide” of displaced Palestinians in the Gaza Strip.
The Israeli army admitted to hitting the UNRWA school in the Nuseirat refugee camp, claiming Hamas fighters were hiding inside.
Nearly eight months into the Israeli war, vast swathes of Gaza lay in ruins amid a crippling blockade of food, clean water, and medicine.

title: Israel mounts S . Lebanon strikes amid  intense operation  threats
message:
The Israeli military conducted a series of intense airstrikes on villages and towns in southern Lebanon on Thursday amid threats that Tel Aviv was preparing to launch a major attack on the neighboring country.
According to the official Lebanese National News Agency (NNA), the Israeli warplanes struck a house in the town of Aadchit.
A Lebanese scouts society in southern Lebanon also said it took part in the rescue mission for people following Israeli airstrikes on the towns of Seddiqine and Kounine.
The Israeli raids come following 11 military operations carried out by the Hezbollah group on Wednesday on Israeli military targets and settlements in northern Israel.
On Wednesday, Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu sent a tough warning to the Lebanese Hezbollah group, stressing that the Israeli army is prepared for "an extremely powerful action" against Lebanon.

title: Psychological warfare | Propaganda , Mind Games & Tactics
message:
psychological warfare, the use of propaganda against an enemy, supported by such military, economic, or political measures as may be required.
Although often looked upon as a modern invention, psychological warfare is of ancient origin.
Professionally managed psychological warfare is usually accompanied by the intelligence functions of propaganda analysis and audience information.
Psychological warfare is sometimes divided by its practitioners into levels reflecting the areas in and the times at which the military propaganda is expected to operate.
Tactical psychological warfare, on the other hand, implies a direct connection with combat operations, the commonest form being the surrender demand.

message:

In the hours before dawn, thousands of paratroopers descended on the Normandy countryside behind the German defenses.
At about 6:30 am some 3,000 Allied landing craft began discharging men onto a stretch of beaches between Cherbourg and Le Havre.
The troops, the air and the navy did all that bravery and devotion to duty could do.
By evening the crisis at Omaha had passed, and tens of thousands of Allied troops had gained a fragile foothold in Hitler’s Fortress Europe.

title: JAMES STACK Obituary
message:
Lance Corporal James Bray Stack, 20, of Arlington Heights, was killed by hostile small arms fire while conducting dismounted combat operations on November 10, 2010, in the Sangin District of Helmand Province, Afghanistan.
His awards for personal service include the Purple Heart, Combat Action Ribbon, National Defense Service Medal, Global War on Terrorism Medal, and Afghanistan Campaign Medal.
He was the beloved husband of Katelyn “Katie” Stack; loving father of Mikayla; loved son of Robert Bruce and Linda Lorraine, nee Bray, Stack; adored brother of Megan Lorraine Stack; dear grandson of Gene (the late Lorraine) Bray and Jo Ann (the late Robert Lee) Stack and; cherished son-in-law of Dawn (Tom) Hedrick; fond brother-in-law to Joanne Savage; also survived by Katie’s grandmother Eleanor Savage and his father-in-law Michael Landeweer.

The Latest | D-Day's 80th anniversary brings World War II veterans back to the beaches of NormandyWorld War II veterans are joining heads of state and others Thursday on the beaches of Normandy to commemorate the 80th anniversary of D-Day.
The assault began with Allied aircraft bombing German defenses in Normandy, followed by around 1,200 aircraft that carried airborne troops.
By the end of the day, nearly 160,000 Allied troops had landed in Normandy, although there were thousands of casualties.
Utah was one of the five landing beaches along the coast of Normandy where Allied troops landed on June 6, 2024.
The family was among a crowd several thousands strong that stretched for kilometers along Utah beach — one of the five beaches along the coast of Normandy where Allied troops landed.

title: Ukraine drone strike halts operations at Russian refinery - World
message:
MOSCOW: A Ukrainian drone attack ignited a fire at an oil refinery in southern Russia, forcing it to halt operations, the regional governor said early Thursday, adding that there were no casualties.
In Rostov-on-Don city, dozens of emergency personnel rushed to put out the flames at the Novoshakhtinsk refinery, according to Governor Vasily Golubev.
“Following a drone strike, a fire broke out at the Novoshakhtinsk refinery,” Golubev wrote on Telegram.
Another drone strike overnight destroyed an oil tank at a depot in Stary Oskol, north of the Ukrainian border, said Belgorod Region Governor Vyacheslav Gladkov.
Ukraine, which has been facing a Russian offensive since February 2022, has upped its attacks on Russian territory in recent months.
event_breakdown: Ukraine continues to launch drone strikes in Russia despite facing a massive Russian offensive.

title: Yemen Houthi rebels unveil solid - fuel  Palestine  missile that resembles Iranian hypersonic
message:
This frame grab from video released by the Ansar Allah Media Office of Yemen's Houthi rebels on Wednesday, June 5, 2024, shows the launch of a Palestine missile from a rebel-controlled area of Yemen.
Yemen's Houthi rebels have unveiled a new, solid-fuel missile in their arsenal that resembles aspects of one earlier displayed by Iran that Tehran described as flying at hypersonic speeds.
(Ansar Allah Media Office via AP)DUBAI – Yemen's Houthi rebels have unveiled a new, solid-fuel missile in their arsenal that resembles aspects of one earlier displayed by Iran that Tehran described as flying at hypersonic speeds.
The rebels fired its new “Palestine” missile, complete with a warhead painted like a Palestinian keffiyeh checkered scarf, at the southern Gulf of Aqaba port of Eilat in Israel on Monday.
For their part, the Houthis described the Palestine as a “locally made” missile.
event_breakdown:
Yemen's Houthi rebels have unveiled a new, solid-fuel missile in their arsenal that resembles aspects of one earlier displayed by Iran that Tehran described as flying at hypersonic speeds. The rebels fired its new “Palestine” missile, complete with a warhead painted like a Palestinian keffiyeh checkered scarf, at the southern Gulf of Aqaba port of Eilat in Israel on Monday.
The missile landed in the water more than 42 miles away, according to officials in the two Gulf countries. Friction plates fixed to the nose of the missile, which are designed to slow it down as it heats the atmosphere, melted when the missile entered the denser air above the Earth. The missile was nearly three times as fast as a bullet as it traveled 1,600 kilometers out over the waters east of Yemen.

title: Germany Scholz supports deporting criminals from Syria , Afghanistan
message:
German Chancellor Olaf Scholz makes a government statement on the "current security situation" in a plenary session of the German Bundestag.
Kay Nietfeld/dpaGerman Chancellor Olaf Scholz wants to allow the deportation of serious criminals to Afghanistan and Syria again, he told the Bundestag on Thursday.
"Serious criminals and terrorist threats have no place here."
Scholz also said that the glorification and celebration of terrorist offences would no longer be tolerated.
"That is why we will tighten our deportation regulations so that a serious interest in deportation arises from the creation of terrorist offences," Scholz said.
event_breakdown:
German Chancellor Olaf Scholz wants to deport serious criminals to Afghanistan and Syria again, he told the Bundestag on Thursday.
Scholz also said that the glorification and celebration of terrorist offences would no longer be tolerated, and that he would tighten his deportation regulations to ensure that a serious interest in deportation arose from the creation of terrorist offences.

message:
VER-SUR-Mer, France (AP) — King Charles III came to northern France on Thursday to honor the 22,442 British troops who died in the Battle of Normandy.
It is also a generation that is quickly passing into history, with the youngest D-Day veterans now nearing their 100th birthdays.
Charles, who spent five years in the Royal Navy, also has a deep personal connection to the World War II generation.
The king and French President Emmanuel Macron led dignitaries in laying wreaths at the British Normandy Memorial.
Almost 62,000 British troops landed that day, or 40% of the total invasion force.

title: US - made munitions used in deadly Israeli strike on UN school in central Gaza
message:
LONDON — US-made munitions were used in a deadly Israeli airstrike on a United Nations-run school in central Gaza on Thursday where Palestinians were sheltering, a CNN analysis of video from the scene and review by an explosive weapons expert has found.
At least 45 people died in strike on the school in the Nuseirat refugee camp, a spokesperson for Gaza's Ministry of Health told CNN.
CNN identified fragments of at least two US-made GBU-39 small diameter bombs (SDB) in video filmed at the scene by a journalist working for CNN.
This incident is the second time in two weeks that CNN has been able to verify the use of US-manufactured munitions in deadly Israeli attacks on displaced Palestinians.

title: Zion man arrested for stabbing relative , killing family dog and child endangerment
message:
ZION, Ill. — A Zion man who ingested illegal drugs is suspected of stabbing a relative, shooting and killing his family dog and stuffing a toddler into a garbage can before being arrested by police, the department said Wednesday.
Zion police officials said around 11:15 a.m. Monday, June 3, officers responded to the area of 31st Street and Gabriel Avenue following reports of a stabbing.
Arriving officers located an 18-year-old male hiding nearby in the 1900 block of Carmel Blvd.
The stabbing victim, suffering from a non-life-threatening injury, named a relative, 22-year-old Arthur Scarborough of Zion, as the offender.
Police said after the shooting, Scarborough grabbed the 2-year-old from the home and put the toddler inside a nearby trash can.

title: D - Day evokes joy of liberation , pain of losses in France | National and World News
message:
One by one, the men fished fragrant, brightly-colored spheres from their pockets and deposited them in Yves Marchais' hands.
The 6-year-old boy had never seen the strange fruits before, growing up in Nazi-occupied France, where food was rationed and terror was everywhere.
Thrilled with his bounty, the young Marchais counted them all — 35 — and dashed home for his first taste of oranges.
They remain eternally grateful for their liberation but cannot forget its steep cost in French lives.
Ruined Normandy towns count their deadSome 20,000 Normandy civilians were killed in the invasion and as Allied forces fought their way inland, sometimes field by field through the leafy Normandy countryside that helped conceal German defenders.

1944 Normandy Invasion: The Allied invasion of Normandy, also known as Operation Overlord or D-Day, took place on June 6, 1944. It was a major World War II military operation that marked the beginning of the Western Front in the European theater. The invasion involved around 160,000 troops from America, Canada, and Britain.

Nazi-occupied France: Nazi-occupied France refers to the period of German military occupation of the country during World War II. It began with the surrender of France in June 1940, when the country was divided into two parts: the occupied northern zone and the Vichy government in the southern zone. The Germans ruled the country with the help of local collaborators, and Jews and other minority groups faced persecution.
